dublin_core.dcvalue: We reviewed scheduled interactive teledermatology consultations from 1997 to 2002 between the Department of Dermatology of Health Waikato in Hamilton and remote sites at Taumarunui Hospital Taupo Health Centre and the Ranolf Medical Centre Rotorua in New Zealand Eighty five per cent of 384 appointments were attended and most non attendances were unexplained The reason for consulting a dermatologist was inflammatory skin disease in 74 of cases cutaneous infection in 10 a skin lesion in 12 and no diagnosis was made in 4 Follow ups were arranged for 41 mainly by telemedicine 74 Despite the apparent success of 75 of consultations and positive feedback from patients attending them the service has not proved sustainable long term This is because of other priorities for the delivery of health care lack of support by clinicians and administrators and ongoing financial costs
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:37:13Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2004-02-13
Retrospective review of teledermatology in the Waikato, 1997-2002.
